Package com.valmet.watermark.service

Class JwtTokenService

java.lang.Object
com.valmet.watermark.service.JwtTokenService
@Service public class JwtTokenService extends Object
JwtTokenService class for handling JWT token operations such as generation and validation.

This class provides functionality for:

  • Generating JWT tokens (access and refresh tokens).
  • Validating refresh tokens to ensure they are valid and not expired.
Version:
1.0
Author:
BJIT

  • Constructor Details

    • JwtTokenService

      public JwtTokenService(org.springframework.security.oauth2.jwt.JwtEncoder jwtEncoder, org.springframework.security.oauth2.jwt.JwtDecoder jwtDecoder, WatermarkSecretsManager watermarkSecretsManager)
      Constructor for initializing the JWT encoder and decoder.
      Parameters:
      jwtEncoder - the JwtEncoder responsible for encoding JWT tokens
      jwtDecoder - the JwtDecoder responsible for decoding and validating JWT tokens
      watermarkSecretsManager - the WatermarkSecretsManager responsible for managing secrets

  • Method Details

    • generateToken

      public String generateToken(org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication, int expireTime, String tokenIssuer, TokenType tokenType, int rsaKeyVersion, String scope)
      Generates a JWT token for a given authentication object.
      Parameters:
      authentication - the Authentication object containing user details and authorities
      expireTime - the expiration time for the token in minutes
      tokenIssuer - the issuer of the token
      tokenType - the type of the token, either ACCESS or REFRESH
      rsaKeyVersion - the version of the RSA key used
      scope - the scope of the token
      Returns:
      the generated JWT token as a string

    • validateRefreshToken

      public org.springframework.security.core.Authentication validateRefreshToken(String refreshToken) throws org.springframework.security.oauth2.jwt.JwtException, InvalidJwtToken, IOException
      Validates a refresh token to ensure it is valid and not expired.
      Parameters:
      refreshToken - the JWT refresh token to validate
      Returns:
      an Authentication object containing the decoded JWT token
      Throws:
      org.springframework.security.oauth2.jwt.JwtException - if the token is invalid, expired, or not a refresh token
      InvalidJwtToken - if the token is invalid or missing
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs
